name: Models Genesis Transforms
body:
## What's Changed
* Models Genesis Transforms by @weningerleon in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/105
* CI for fork PRs by @Borda in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/118
* Attempt to fix docs builds by @justusschock in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/120
* Pre-commit by @Borda in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/117
* imports: Isort by @Borda in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/119
* Update README.md by @justusschock in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/121
* using Black by @Borda in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/122
* [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit suggestions by @pre-commit-ci in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/123

## New Contributors
* @weningerleon made their first contribution in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/105
* @Borda made their first contribution in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/118
* @pre-commit-ci made their first contribution in https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/pull/123

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/compare/v0.2.1...v0.2.2

name: Bugfix Release
body:
Includes the following fixes:

* Download of mednist (#101)
* Adds `BaseTransformSeeded` + warnings (#100)
* Adds compatibility with newer torch versions (#106)
* Adds correct image transforms (#110)
* Fixes support for DDP (#116)

Thanks to @NKPmedia @ndalton12 @FirasGit @mibaumgartner for these fixes

name: Release 0.2.0
body:
# New Features

* Add Resizing Transforms [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/6d7c9432b90247f8b9e0ab3e6881e88fb7749d4)
* Transforms for filter an remove keys [Commit](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/f69f36918a03bac835ff6bbe9b5cc7045bcf5d92)
* Add support for Python 3.8 [Commit](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/4e347fb1252c53189417adcbeb8ef13f8471712f)
* Transforms in Compose can now be shuffled [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/70c133a231bec1d8bb858e9d82a81b88651d874e)
* Test Examples more intesively [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/b39d2abd190fcb76b3ed908a65e42f9492c7dcd6)
* Random Parameter Injection API [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/63559c6c50c354c44ae7c1fa4f9c7788adc4be39)
* Transform to Rename Keys [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/e7c3eb2a00db0349f700a687263d8e3b8a1dbc40)
* ArgMax Transform [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/e7c3eb2a00db0349f700a687263d8e3b8a1dbc40)
* OneOf Transform [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/e7c3eb2a00db0349f700a687263d8e3b8a1dbc40)
* Per Sample Option for Affines [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/583119902cf8b5347396803b4812105479c35728)
* Hosted Docs on [ReadTheDocs](https://rising.rtfd.io)
* Tested and available Examples on [ReadTheDocs](https://rising.rtfd.io/en/latest/tutorials.html)
* Segmentation Example with PyTorch Lightning (3D)
* Classification Example with PyTorch Lightning (2D)

# Bug Fixes/Enhancements
* Use `ModuleList` in Compose Transforms [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/5053ca76f7fc43ff813748d040c69d490ba0210c)
* Update DataLoader for better integration with frameworks like PyTorch Lightning or PyTorch ignite, which parse the loaders attributes [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/d9bf35202e59b04d566208310046efb7c429bef6)
* Make transforms in compose mutable [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/9423a31bd117ac64c294997ae0c5d755024d8fd8)
* Refactoring for Python 3.6 Support [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/79c815e55270ef934120fb7be715af6bc53b6d3a)
* Tests on all major platforms [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/89a10c72d927b72241ed9138099f4f2a0e015a3f)
* Filter warnings after first occurence [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/29457c9ba8435369bb1db259cb7488698cde755b)
* Disable Warnings in all workers but one [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/484f11f652fdb245dc6f10500443d41407c03a0b)

# Breaking Changes
* Cleanup Affine Interface [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/a11abc7cd1c57bdf66f5a61fcfc5140e395a7246)
* Remove previous random transforms for random parameter injection API [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/63559c6c50c354c44ae7c1fa4f9c7788adc4be39)
* Move device functional [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/e7c3eb2a00db0349f700a687263d8e3b8a1dbc40)

# Deprecations
*--None--*

# Removals
* Remove Data Containers [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/cc622d423cf58136cde86860e746e119f3f0a7fb)

name: Release v 0.1.0
body:
This release candidate is the first ever release containing the most convenient transforms as well as a brand new `DataLoader` class.

## New Features
* Option to Compose single transforms [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/f825221d9c3c5983987f6457f032bf6099a97ea7)
* First spatial Transforms [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/79583d5eb078b0996fcb66b588c3289ba99535bf)
* Custom Dataloader as Drop-In replacement for PyTorch  [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/5880178a1b3d18c1e9e71e8bde342bc28b64b937)
* Custom Dataset Class to extend the [PyTorch](https://pytorch.org) dataset  [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/1d650858a39a50915ba76ccd4a7505b5b535dc7d)
* Transform call dispatching algorithm can now be changed by user [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/8100def3afec30a6981bb1435010834ba95746a0)
* Utility Transforms [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/0b6702033070c5143e51390ace89a82e417398f8)
* User-Controllable call dispatch within the `Compose` class [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/0b881f8e0ce85f380ecf458080c2a3f5cb8c3080)
* Basic Affine Transforms [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/6b9a7b2fdc7d0b894c0dfcfd94237845fe8b8672)

## Bug Fixes/Enhancements
* Shared memory for progressive resizing [[Commit]](https://github.com/PhoenixDL/rising/commit/6b90197e89dedd7659073bf72037390231a1c278)

## Breaking Changes
_--None--_

## Deprecations
_--None--_

## Removals
_--None--_

## Towards the API
The new `DataLoader` class was defined to be an exact drop-in replacement for the loader provided by [PyTorch](https://pytorch.org). As such it only extends the PyTorch loader but under the hood it uses the same multiprocessing and structure as the one already available.

* Support for Batch-Transformations
* Support for GPU Transformations
* Support to disable automated conversion to `torch.Tensor`
* Support to specify, how the transform call should be dispatched
* Automated seed for `numpy` in all child processes

However there are some limitations to this:
* using CUDA from different processes is troublesome on most machines
* GPU transforms will therefore always be executed after the CPU `batch_transforms`

The usage is quite simple: Just replace the import! all your previous keywords are still working correctly, but there are some new keywords available for the previously mentioned features:

**Before:**
```python
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader
dset = torchvision.datasets.MNIST(root='/tmp', dowload=True)
# this does not seed numpy per worker
loader = DataLoader(dset, shuffle=True, num_workers=4)
```

**Ours:**
```python
from rising.loading import DataLoader
dset = torchvision.datasets.MNIST(root='/tmp', dowload=True)
# this also seeds numpy!
loader = DataLoader(dset, shuffle=True, num_workers=4)
```

> **Note:** To seed numpy for all child processes in a reproducible way, it must be seeded in the main process, since the base-seed for all the child processes is computed within the main process!

name: First Alpha Release
body:
This release includes the following:

* Basic tensor operations (currently numpy and torch one hot transformations)
* Basic spatial transforms (mirroring and ro90)
* Intensity transforms (norm_min_max, norm_range, norm_zero_mean_unit_std, add_noise, gamma_correction, add_value, scale_by_value)
